item.title: Rubbish constantly dumped on the corner of Amhurst Road and Sydner Road, 20th October
item.description:
Corner of Amhurst Road and Sydner Road is used to dump rubbish constantly there is currently a selection of various items dumped No sooner is the rubbish is collected more is dumped in the same spot
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water in many various areas soaking pedestrians walking along the footpath, 20th October
item.description:
This whole road pools loads of surface water in many various places- from number 1-15 the road surface has a defect which pools water, there is no drain that alleviates the water build up and so innocent pedestrians get soaked by careless drivers travelling along this road. Outside 31 onwards the road surface has lots of dips and ripples in it causing whiplash due to parked cars on the pavement side, as the road surface on the bushes side is tragic and needs resurfacing urgently! At the Gwillam close end there are several drains that are inches above the road surface so this is also a defect because how will water ever travel down them alleviating puddles? Fact is they won’t. So these drains need to be lowered and resurfacing needs to happen here too!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black van fly-tipping 2 big sofas, 20th October

item.title: The road pools puddles along footpath, 20th October
item.description:
This road needs some major works in terms of drainage of puddles during wet spells. If a pedestrian walks along the footpath (house side) vehicles travelling along the road drench pedestrians because the road loops in so many areas right along the road and several drains are higher than the road surface so how will they ever drain surface water??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Narrow pavement due to very large electrical box, 20th October
item.description:
There is a very large electrical box outside the Suttons fish and chip shop making the pavement narrow and causing pedestrians to walk on the road at busy times This is the second time I'm making this complaint, my first was closed as not TFL's problem. If that is the case could you tell me who is responsible for the pavement on StokeNewington High Street. There had to have been a planning proposal for this object, it was installed by a company called TOFCO and must be linked to the electric charging points for cars Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Tyssen Road, West Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracked Pavement causing a leak into property, 20th October
item.description:
When it rains or the pavement is jet washed the water is running through the crack in the pavement and leaking into the restaurant (smoky boys, 23 Haymarket) toilets and electrical store room. Water in the electrics has caused serious issues and is now a serious fire risk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Suffolk Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain again, 20th October
item.description:
I have reported this drain multiple times and I get notice that it’s been dealt with but everytime it rains it floods and it’s obvious that this has not been dealt with properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Essendine Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nails nuts and bolt and other metal spillage on rd, 20th October
item.description:
I am constantly sweeping nails,metal etc from rd,spilled from speeding scrap metal vehicles and Lorrie’s,causing tyres to be punctured,which I have experienced. Posts have been taken from width restriction on Slade green rd which enables these vehicles to speed through. The gutters on Slade green rd, nr Canada rd need clearing from metal,nails etc.And posts need to go back urgently
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
